extendedInfo.description: The Official Mya App.Grammy Award Winning Artist MÃ½a, is celebrating 14 years in the entertainment industry as an internationally known, respected singer, songwriter, producer, dancer/choreographer, actress, designer, model, activist and philanthropist. In Fall 2009 MÃ½a entertained the world and impressed millions as the highest scoring contestant on ABCâs Season 9 of Dancing With The Stars. MÃ½a also created her own label, Planet 9, and released the first of a series of independent music compilations, Sugar & Spice LP and âThe Perfect Editionâ double disc in Japan in 2008 & 2009.  MÃ½a finished out the decade as one of Billboardâs Hot 100 Artists Of the Decade, and was featured on a number of diverse charts & top 10 lists from Fuseâs Sexiest Videos of All Time to VH1 Latin Americaâs Top Videos of The Decade. In 2010 we will see various musical releases from MÃ½a including collaboration with Cedric Gervais of Ultra Records, the worldâs top dance label, titled âLove is The Answer.â In 2010 MÃ½a also reprised her role as National Spokesperson for The North Shore Animal Leagueâs Tour For Life and is featured in the Wyclef Jean remake of We Are the World, to benefit Haiti.Washington, DC native MÃ½a released her self titled, double platinum, debut album, MÃ½a, in 1998. The album launched the then 18 year old MÃ½a into the fabric of pop-culture, where she has remained ever since.  MÃ½a featured the massively successful singles âItâs All About Meâ, âMovin Onâ, and âMy First Night With Youâ. In addition to her solo work, Mya was also a featured artist with Olâ Dirty Bastard on Prasâ 1998 Grammy nominated hit, âGhetto Supastar (That Is What You Are)â, from the Bulworth soundtrack and âTake Me Thereâ from The Rugrats Movie soundtrack, with Blackstreet and Ma$e. In 2000, MÃ½a released her second album, Fear of Flying. Its first single, âThe Best of Meâ, featured rapper Jadakiss and Jay-Z appeared on the singleâs hit remix âBest of Me-part 2.â Following the massive success of the second single âCase of the Exâ, Fear of Flying was re-released featuring the brand new smash, and third single, âFree.â Just as Fear of Flying went platinum, MÃ½a recorded âWhere the Dream Takes Youâ the theme song for Walt Disneyâs Atlantis: The Lost Empire.In May 2001, MÃ½a collaborated with Christina Aguilera, Lilâ Kim, P!nk and Missy Elliot on a remake of LaBelleâs âLady Marmaladeâ, which is featured in Baz Luhrmanâs Moulin Rouge. The single sold 5.5 million copies and became the most successful airplay-only single in history. MÃ½a and companyâs version of âLady Marmaladeâ won the Grammy Award for Best Pop Collaboration and went on to collect numerous awards including 2 MTV Video Music Awards for Video of the Year and Best Video from a Film.In 2003, MÃ½a released her third studio album, the critically acclaimed, Moodring, featuring the hit singles including âMy Love Is Like Woâ and âFallenâ and the club circuit favorite, âWhatever Bitch.â Moodring also featured âEverything or Nothingâ, the theme song for the 2004 video game James Bond 007: Everything or Nothing in which MÃ½a was featured as a Bond Girl, and âReal Compared to Whatâ the 2003 Coca-Cola theme song, for whom MÃ½a was a spokesperson at the time. MÃ½a and Madonna are the only two artists to perform a Bond song and act in their respective Bond projects: MÃ½a plays NSA Agent Mya Starling in Everything or Nothing while Madonna plays fencing coach Verity in Die Another Day.
